body:
(In reference to original suggestion to delete glossary)

As weird as it sounds. Yeah.

First, see https://github.com/perl6/doc/issues/724.

Then, take a fresh look at our glossary.

Half of the terms on that page are already described elsewhere. Let's pick one randomly: [Subroutine](https://docs.perl6.org/language/glossary#Subroutine_).
It is already explained on [language/functions](https://docs.perl6.org/language/functions#Subroutines).
Possible fix: Add `X<|Subroutine>` to the language/functions page to make it searchable, remove “Subroutine” from the glossary (you may move the glossary definition to language/functions page, if you wish).

Does it sound a bit too harsh? Yes, but can you name any other viable solution? Look, if we want to have every term that can be in the glossary, then there's a lot of work to do, and all that work is about duplicating existing information (from other pages). Otherwise we will have what we have now: some terms are described in the glossary and other terms are described elsewhere, with no real reason why.

Search box is our glossary now, and that's totally OK.

Also, glossary is one of those pages nobody worked on for a while. I don't think that it is going to change any time soon.

In other words, glossary served a very useful function when the rest of the documentation was very incomplete. Now there's no need to keep it, instead we can tell people to rely on the search function.

**Comments are welcome!** Maybe there are good reasons to keep it?

Also, maybe this issue should've been titled “Great Glossary Cleanup”… but that does not clearly indicate what's going to happen ;)
## Meanwhile, here is a TODO list

**⚠ Feel free to edit this list!**

- `create language/*` means that there is a topic which is good on its own. Any volunteers to start these pages? If you agree that such page should exist, then please add it to https://github.com/perl6/doc/issues/114
